intro: [WRONG START] Achimenses longiflora var. albida, commonly known as the white achimenes, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive yellow center. The plant produces tubular flowers that open in the morning and close in the evening, a trait known as nyctinasty. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Achimenes longiflora var. albida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beauty and ease of care.
